Package etomica.thermointegration

Class IntegratorThermodynamic

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.integrator.Integrator
      • etomica.thermointegration.IntegratorThermodynamic
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntegratorThermodynamicPEvsT

    public abstract class IntegratorThermodynamic
extends Integrator
    Abstract class suitable as a parent class for thermodynamic integration integrators. Subclasses should implement advanceParameters to advance the thermodynamic parameter (or parameters) of interest. Data collection can be performed as interval actions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class etomica.integrator.Integrator

        Integrator.Forcible, Integrator.Torquable

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      IntegratorThermodynamic​(Integrator subIntegrator)
      Constructs a thermodynamic integrator that operates with the given sub integrator, which is responsible for exploring configruations at any given state point.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset​()
           throws ConfigurationOverlapException
        Resets this integrator and passes on the reset to the subIntegrator. Thermodynamic integration will start back at the initial parameter(s). An data collected will be reset
        Overrides:
        reset in class Integrator
        Throws:
        ConfigurationOverlapException

      • getSubIntegrator

        public Integrator getSubIntegrator​()
        Returns the subIntegrator, responsible for actually walking through configurational space.

      • doStepInternal

        protected void doStepInternal​()
        Performs a step in the subIntegrator. If numSubsteps have been performed since the last advance of the thermodynamic parameter(s), the parameters are advanced again.
        Specified by:
        doStepInternal in class Integrator

      • advanceParameters

        protected abstract void advanceParameters​()
        Method to advance the thermodynamic parameter(s) of interest as part of the thermodynamic integration. The subclass implements this method. The subclass is also responsible for pulling out whatever data it wants (from the DataPumps, or elsewhere) and storing that.

      • setNumSubsteps

        public void setNumSubsteps​(int newNumSubsteps)
        Sets the number of steps performed at each thermodynamic state point.

        public int getNumSubsteps​()
        Returns the number of steps performed at each thermodynamic state point.
